org.jslipc.ipc.pipe.shm

Class SharedMemoryPipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jslipc.ipc.pipe.shm.SharedMemoryPipe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, JslipcBinman, JslipcPipe

    public class SharedMemoryPipe
extends Object
implements JslipcPipe, JslipcBinman
    This pipe uses shared memory to create in-memory buffers which are used to set up two ByteBufferQueues as a backend for two (uni-directional) channels. Which buffer/channel is used for reading or writing depends on the given role, so the role is needed to distinguish the two endpoints, but do not have any further semantics.

    Be aware that the buffers are limited to the given size and thus are implemented as ring-buffers. So, you can not write if the buffer is full, or read if the buffer is empty. If you are using streams on top of the channel, they will block in this situation. The content of the shared memory is never forced to write back to disk, so the buffer is volatile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SharedMemoryPipe

        public SharedMemoryPipe(File file,
                JslipcRole role)
                 throws IOException
        Creates a pipe with the given parameter in shared memory. The given file is mapped into memory (to create shared memory), where a default size of 4k of shared memory is allocated. The role itself does not have any special semantics, means: it makes no difference whether you are server or yang. It is just needed to distinguish the endpoints of the pipe, so one end should have the role yin, the other yang.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • SharedMemoryPipe

        public SharedMemoryPipe(File file,
                int size,
                JslipcRole role)
                 throws IOException
        Creates a pipe with the given parameter in shared memory. The given file is mapped into memory (to create shared memory), where the size indicates the amount of shared memory to allocate. The role itself does not have any special semantics, means: it makes no difference whether you are server or yang. It is just needed to distinguish the endpoints of the pipe, so one end should have the role yin, the other yang.
        Parameters:
        file -
        size -
        role -
        Throws:
        IOException
